resources.string: Mercury is a scorched planet closest to the Sun.
Venus is a sweltering world with a runaway greenhouse effect.
Earth is our home teeming with life.
Mars is a red planet with potential signs of past habitability.
Ceres is the largest object in the asteroid belt, considered a dwarf planet, and it holds valuable insights into the early solar system\'s history.
Jupiter is the largest gas giant with a striking Great Red Spot.
Saturn is adorned by its iconic rings.
Uranus is an ice giant tilted on its side.
Neptune is the farthest known ice giant with a striking blue hue.
Pluto is a dwarf planet in the Kuiper Belt.
